newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' 7-year T-notes falls to 14.875 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' 7-year T-notes falls to 14.875 pct.

text.p: The coupon rate on the Philippines' seven-year fixed rate treasury notes fell to 14.875 percent at an auction on Tuesday from 15.75 at the previous auction in July, the Bureau of Treasury said.
The auction saw 8.369 billion pesos worth of bids, of which 2.0 billion pesos were accepted.
The average rate was at 14.751 percent, with bids ranging from 14.980 to 14.250.
The government was able to get an attractive price for the seven-year bonds due to the huge demand by pension funds and insurance companies, traders said.
"There is no supply of seven-year bonds in the secondary market because of its attractive yield curves in the previous auctions," one dealer said.

A reduced auction volume to 2.0 billion pesos from 3.0 billion pesos also whetted investors' appetited, the same dealer said. The lower volume was in line with government's programme to reduce its borrowings for the fourth quarter.
The seven-year auction is usually held every two months but the government postponed it in September to make way for the maiden offering of 10-year bonds.
